items.description: List of domains associated to be associated the Account

external_id.description: ID of the Account in an external system

custom_fields.description: Custom field attributes for this account. Do not include the custom_fields object if you do not wish to update the attributes. Including the custom_fields object with empty values will automatically remove the unspecified fields from the account.

contacts.description: Link to contacts associated to the account

items.description: List of domains associated to the Account

external_id.description: ID of the Account in an External system, such as your backoffice system or CRM

created_at.description: Timestamp when the account was created

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the account was updated

contact_ids.description: List of IDs of the contacts to add in the requested group

start.description: Start time of the data to include in the export (seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00+00). Will be rounded down to the start of the day.

end.description: End time of the data to include in the export (seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00+00). Will be rounded up to the end of the day.

timezone.description: [IANA name](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones) of the timezone to format the dates with. If omitted, the export will use Etc/UTC.

progress.description: Number ranging from 0 to 100 corresponding to the percentage of the analytics processed.

url.description: The URL from which the export data can be downloaded.

size.description: Size (in bytes) of the export data.

created_at.description: Timestamp (in seconds) at which the export was requested.

AnalyticsFilters.description: Resources to compute the analytics for. Defaults to all.

start.description: Start time of the data to include in the export (seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00+00). Will be rounded down to the start of the day.

end.description: End time of the data to include in the export (seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00+00). Will be rounded up to the end of the day.

timezone.description: [IANA name](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones) of the timezone to format the dates with. If omitted, the export will use Etc/UTC.

progress.description: Number ranging from 0 to 100 corresponding to the percentage of the analytics processed.

metrics.description: The metrics computed for the report.

value.description: The value of a scalar metric.

url.description: URL to download the attached file

content_type.description: Content type of the attached file

size.description: Size (in byte) of the attached file

is_inline.description: Whether or not the attachment is part of the message body

cid.description: Unique identifier used to link an attachment to where it is used in the message body

send_as.description: Address which appears as the sender for messages sent from Front

undo_send_time.description: The time (measured in seconds) that users have to undo a send operation in the channel.

all_teammates_can_reply.description: Whether teammates without inbox access can reply on this channel. Only present for shared channels; omitted for private channels.

is_private.description: Whether or not the channel is individual

is_valid.description: Whether or not the channel configuration is valid

posted_at.description: Date at which the comment was posted

attachments.description: List of files attached to the comment

avatar.description: Binary data of avatar. Must use `Content-Type: multipart/form-data` if specified.

is_spammer.description: Whether or not the contact is marked as a spammer

links.description: List of all the links of the contact

group_names.description: List of all the group names the contact belongs to. It will automatically create missing groups

custom_fields.description: Custom field attributes for this contact. Do not include the custom_fields object if you do not wish to update the attributes. Including the custom_fields object with empty values will automatically remove the unspecified fields from the contact.

is_private.description: Whether or not the contact is individual

handle.description: Handle used to reach the contact.

source.description: Source of the handle. Can be `email`, `phone`, `twitter`, `facebook`, `intercom`, `front_chat`, or `custom`.

created_at.description: Date at which the note have been created

is_spammer.description: Whether or not the contact is marked as a spammer

links.description: List of all the links of the contact

groups.description: List of the groups the contact belongs to.

handles.description: List of the handles and sources with which the contact is reachable.

custom_fields.description: Custom field attributes for this contact.

is_private.description: Whether or not the contact is individual

last_message.description: Link to last message of the conversation

subject.description: Subject of the message for email message

assignee.description: Partial representation of the teammate assigned to the conversation

tags.description: List of the tags for this conversation

custom_fields.description: Custom field attributes for this conversation

created_at.description: Timestamp at which the conversation have been created.

is_private.description: Whether or not the conversation is private

scheduled_reminders.description: List of scheduled (non-expired and non-canceled) reminders for this conversation

external_conversation_ids.description: List of external_ids for partner channel associated with the conversation. Only present for partner channel token authenticated requests.

undo_send_time.description: The time (measured in seconds) that users have to undo a send operation in the channel.

all_teammates_can_reply.description: Whether teammates without inbox access can reply on this channel. Only allowed for shared channels.

webhook_url.description: The webhook URL outbound messages should be sent to. Only allowed for "custom" type channels.

author_id.description: ID of the teammate creating the comment. If omitted, will post as the API Token or OAuth client of the requester.

handles.description: List of the handles for this contact. Each handle object should include `handle` and `source` fields.

author_id.description: ID of teammate creating the note

inbox_id.description: Inbox ID for the conversation. Either `inbox_id` OR `teammate_ids` must be provided (not both).

teammate_ids.description: Teammates to add to the conversation. Either `inbox_id` OR `teammate_ids` must be provided (not both).

mode.description: Mode of the draft to create. Can be 'private' (draft is visible to the author only) or 'shared' (draft is visible to all teammates with access to the conversation).

signature_id.description: ID of the signature to attach to this draft. If null, no signature is attached.

should_add_default_signature.description: Whether or not Front should try to resolve a signature for the message. Is ignored if signature_id is included. Default false;

CreateLink.description: A link is used to connect a Front conversation to an external resource.

name.description: Name of the link. If none is specified, the external_url is used as a default

external_url.description: Underlying identifying url of the link

subject.description: Subject of the message template. If not set, the name will be used to populate the subject.

items.description: The specific inboxes this template is available in. If unspecified or null, then it will be available in all inboxes. Array should be non-empty.

parent_folder_id.description: ID of the parent folder to be placed into. Goes into the root folder if unspecified or if null.

sender_info.description: Sender info of the signature that will appear in the From line of emails sent.

EventResponse.description: An event is created everytime something interesting is happening in Front.

emitted_at.description: Date at which the event has been emitted

data.description: The resource which triggered the event

target.description: Partial representation (type & id) of the event's target

data.description: The resource which received the event

conversation.description: The conversation on which the event happened

body_format.description: Format of the message body. Can be `markdown` (default) or `html`, and can only be specified for `email` type.

external_id.description: External identifier of the message. Front won't import two messages with the same external ID.

created_at.description: Date at which the message as been sent or received.

type.description: Type of the message to import. Default is `email`.

assignee_id.description: ID of the teammate who will be assigned to the conversation.

tags.description: List of tag names to add to the conversation

conversation_id.description: If supplied, Front will thread this message into conversation with the given ID. Note that including this parameter nullifies the `thread_ref` parameter _completely_.

thread_ref.description: Reference which will be used to thread messages. If  omitted, Front threads by sender instead

is_inbound.description: Determines if message is received (inbound) or sent (outbound) by you.

is_archived.description: Determines if message is archived after import.

should_skip_rules.description: Determines if rules should be skipped. `true` by default.

type.description: Type of the link. Typically associated with the underlying link provider (if known)

external_url.description: Underlying identifying external URL of the link

target_contact_id.description: Optional contact ID to merge the other contacts into.

contact_ids.description: Array of all the contact IDs of the contacts to be merged.  If a target contact id is provided and that contact id is not in this array, the length of this array must be between 1 and 49.  If no target contact id is provided or it is contained in this array, the length must be between 2 and 50.

message_replied_to.description: Link to message this message replied to

draft_mode.description: If the message is a draft, describes the draft mode. Can be 'private' (draft is visible to the author only) or 'shared' (draft is visible to all teammates with access to the conversation).

error_type.description: Type of the error when the draft failed to be sent

version.description: The current version of the message in Front

duration.description: For `truly-call` messages only. Length of the call in seconds.

have_been_answered.description: For `truly-call` messages only. Whether or not the call have been answered.

external_id.description: For `tweet` or 'custom' (partner channel token authenticated) messages only. Unique message identifier in the underlying provider (Twitter or Partner). For custom messages, only present for partner channel token authenticated requests.

is_retweet.description: For `tweet` messages only. Whether or not the tweet is a retweet.

have_been_retweeted.description: For `tweet` messages only. Whether or not the tweet have been retweeted.

have_been_favorited.description: For `tweet` messages only. Whether or not the tweet have been favorited.

thread_ref.description: For `custom` messages only. Custom reference which is used to thread messages.

headers.description: For `custom` messages only. Custom object holding internal information.

chat_visitor_url.description: For `front_chat` messages only. Source URL from the chat widget when sending a message.

username.description: Username of the teammate (used for "@" mentions)

is_admin.description: Whether or not the teammate is an admin in your company

is_available.description: Whether or not the teammate is available

is_blocked.description: Whether or not the teammate account has been blocked

inbox_id.description: ID of the inbox to move this channel to. Will also move corresponding conversations.

settings.description:
Settings to replace.
For custom channels, all settings may be replaced.
For all other channels, only `undo_send_time` and `all_teammates_can_reply` may be replaced.

undo_send_time.description: The time (measured in seconds) that users have to undo a send operation in the channel.

all_teammates_can_reply.description: Whether teammates without inbox access can reply on this channel. Only allowed for shared channels.

assignee_id.description: ID of the teammate to assign the conversation to. Set it to null to unassign.

inbox_id.description: ID of the inbox to move the conversation to.

tag_ids.description: List of all the tag IDs replacing the old conversation tags

custom_fields.description: Custom field attributes for this conversation. Do not include the custom_fields object if you do not wish to update the attributes. Including the custom_fields object with empty values will automatically remove the unspecified fields from the conversation.

assignee_id.description: ID of the teammate to assign the conversation to. Set it to null to unassign.

teammate_id.description: ID of the teammate to create a reminder for. For a private conversation, specify the id of the teammate that owns the conversation. For a shared conversation, use the id of any teammate that has access to the conversation's shared inbox.

scheduled_at.description: Timestamp to schedule the reminder for. Set to null to cancel.

folder_id.description: ID of the parent folder to be placed into. Goes into the root folder if unspecified or if null.

items.description: The specific inboxes this template is available in. If null, then it will be available in all inboxes. Array should be non-empty. If unspecified, will retain previous value.

attachments.description: Binary data of attached files. Must use `Content-Type: multipart/form-data` if specified. See [example](https://dev.frontapp.com/docs/attachments-1). Specify an empty array to delete all attachments from a message template. If unspecified, it will retain previous value.

UpdateMessageTemplateFolder.description: A message template folder that is used to store message templates or other folders.

name.description: Name of the message template folder

parent_folder_id.description: ID of the parent folder to be placed into. Goes into the root folder if unspecified or if null.

timezone.description: A timezone name as defined in the IANA tz database

times.description: The shift intervals per day of the week

teammate_ids.description: List of all the teammate ids who will be part of this shift.

UpdateSignature.description: A signature that can be used to sign messages.

sender_info.description: Sender info of the signature that will appear in the From line of emails sent.

is_visible_for_all_teammate_channels.description: Whether or not the signature is visible in all individual channels for teammates in the given team. Can only be set for shared signatures.

is_default.description: If true, the signature will be set as the default signature for the team or teammate.

items.description: The specific shared channels this signature if available in. If null, then it will be available in all channels. If unspecified, will retain previous value.

parent_tag_id.description: ID of the parent of this tag. Set to `null` to remove  the parent tag.

is_visible_in_conversation_lists.description: Whether the tag is visible in conversation lists.

username.description: New username. It must be unique and can only contains lowercase letters, numbers and underscores.

custom_fields.description: Custom field attributes for this teammate. Do not include the custom_fields object if you do not wish to update the attributes. Including the custom_fields object with empty values will automatically remove the unspecified fields from the teammate.

activityQuery.name: q
activityQuery.description: Search query object with optional properties `before`, `after`, or `types`. `before` and `after` should be a timestamp in seconds with up to 3 decimal places. `types` should be a list of event types.

cardQuery.name: q
cardQuery.description: Search query object with the optional properties `updated_after` and `updated_before`, whose value should be a timestamp in seconds with up to 3 decimal places.

conversationQuery.name: q
conversationQuery.description: Search query object with a property `statuses`, whose value should be a list of conversation statuses (`assigned`, `unassigned`, `archived`, or `deleted`).

topicQuery.name: q
topicQuery.description: Search query object with a property `types`, whose value should be a list of link types (examples - `web`, `jira`, `asana` ).

get.description: List the accounts of the company.

post.description: Create a new account.

get.description: Fetches an account
Lists the contacts associated to an Account

post.description: Adds a list of contacts to an Account

delete.description: Removes a list of contacts from an Account

post.description:
Create a new analytics export of messages or activities over a specific time span.
The export will be executed asynchronously. The response will include a link that can be used to retrieve the
export status & result.

Create a new analytics report for a set of metrics over a specific time span.
The report will be executed asynchronously. The response will include a link that can be used to retrieve the
report status & result.

get.description: List the channels of the company.
Fetch a channel.

post.description: Create a draft message which is the first message of a new conversation.
Receive a custom message in Front. This endpoint is available for custom channels **ONLY**.
Send a new message from a channel.
Asynchronously validate a channel

get.description: Fetches a comment.
List the teammates mentioned in a comment.
List the contact groups.

post.description: Create a new contact group in the default team.

get.description: List the contacts belonging to the requested group.

post.description: Add contacts to the requested group.

delete.description: Remove contacts from the requested group.

get.description: List the contacts of the company.

post.description: Create a new contact.

get.description: Lists the custom fields in your company that are application to a Contact.

post.description:
Merges the contacts specified into a single contact, deleting the merged-in contacts.
If a target contact ID is supplied, the other contacts will be merged into that one.
Otherwise, some contact in the contact ID list will be treated as the target contact.
Merge conflicts will be resolved in the following ways:
  * name will prioritize manually-updated and non-private contact names
  * descriptions will be concatenated and separated by newlines in order from
    oldest to newest with the (optional) target contact's description first
  * all handles, groups, links, and notes will be preserved
  * other conflicts will use the most recently updated contact's value

get.description: Fetch a contact.

List the conversations for a contact in reverse chronological order (newest first). For more advanced filtering, see the [search endpoint](https://dev.frontapp.com/reference/conversations#search-conversations).
>  Deprecated field included
>
> This endpoint returns a deprecated `last_message` field in the top-level conversation bodies listed. Please use the
> `_links.related.last_message` field instead.

post.description: Adds a new handle to a contact.

delete.description: Remove a handle from a contact.

get.description: List the notes added to a contact.

post.description: Create a new note on a contact.

get.description:
List the conversations in the company in reverse chronological order (most recently updated first). The order will respect your company's [bump settings](https://help.front.com/t/y729th/customize-when-conversations-bump-up), which determine when conversations bump to the top. For more advanced filtering, see the [search endpoint](https://dev.frontapp.com/reference/conversations#search-conversations).
>  Deprecated field included
>
> This endpoint returns a deprecated `last_message` field in the top-level conversation bodies listed. Please use the
> `_links.related.last_message` field instead.

post.description:
Create a conversation.
>  Currently, only discussions can be created with this endpoint.

get.description:
Search for conversations. Response will include a count of total matches and an array of conversations in descending order by last activity.
See the [search syntax documentation](https://dev.frontapp.com/docs/search-1) for usage examples.
**Note:** This endpoint is subject to [proportional rate limiting](https://dev.frontapp.com/docs/rate-limiting#additional-proportional-limiting) at 40% of your company's rate limit.
>  Deprecated field included
>
> This endpoint returns a deprecated `last_message` field in the top-level conversation bodies listed. Please use the
> `_links.related.last_message` field instead.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search query string. See available Conversation Search Parameters below

get.description:
Fetch a conversation.
>  Deprecated field included
>
> This endpoint returns a deprecated `last_message` field in the main body. Please use the
> `_links.related.last_message` field instead.
List the comments in a conversation in reverse chronological order (newest first).

post.description: Add a comment to a conversation.

get.description: List the drafts in a conversation.

post.description: Create a new draft as a reply to the last message in the conversation.

get.description: List the events that occured for a conversation in reverse chronological order (newest first). The order will respect your company's [bump settings](https://help.front.com/t/y729th/customize-when-conversations-bump-up), which determine when conversations bump to the top.
List the teammates following a conversation.

delete.description: Removes teammates from the list of followers of a conversation.

teammate_ids.description: IDs of the teammate to remove from the followers list.

get.description: List the inboxes in which a conversation is listed.

post.description: Adds one or more links to a conversation

link_ids.description: Link IDs to add. Either link_ids or link_external_urls must be specified but not both

link_external_urls.description: Link external URLs to add. Creates links if necessary. Either link_ids or link_external_urls must be specified but not both

delete.description: Removes one or more links to a conversation

get.description: List the messages in a conversation in reverse chronological order (newest first).

post.description: Reply to a conversation by sending a message and appending it to the conversation.

patch.description:
Snooze or unsnooze a conversation for the provided user.
For private conversations, reminders can only be created and edited through the API for teammates that own the conversation.
For shared conversations, reminders created and edited through the API are shared for all teammates within the shared inbox(es) that the conversation belongs to.

post.description: Adds one or more tags to a conversation

delete.description: Removes one or more tags to a conversation

get.description:
Lists the custom fields in your company that are application to a Contact.

>  Deprecated endpoint
>
> This endpoint has been deprecated. Please use the fully compatible `GET /contacts/custom_fields` endpoint instead.
Download an attachment file.

Lists all the detailed events which occured in the inboxes of the company ordered in reverse chronological order (newest first).
Refer to the [Events](https://dev.frontapp.com/reference/events) topic for more information, including sorting and filtering.
>  Deprecated field may be included
>
> This route return the deprecated `last_message` conversation field for conversations
> associated with individual events. Please use the conversation's
> `_links.related.last_message` field instead.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of results per page (max 15)

get.description:
Fetch an event.
Refer to the [Events](https://dev.frontapp.com/reference/events) topic for more information, including sorting and filtering.
>  Deprecated field may be included
>
> This route return the deprecated `last_message` conversation field for conversations
> associated with individual events. Please use the conversation's
> `_links.related.last_message` field instead.
List the inboxes of the company.

post.description: Create an inbox in the default team.

get.description: Fetch an inbox.
List the channels in an inbox.

post.description: Create a channel in an inbox.

get.description:
List the conversations in an inbox. For more advanced filtering, see the [search endpoint](https://dev.frontapp.com/reference/conversations#search-conversations).
>  Deprecated field included
>
> This endpoint returns a deprecated `last_message` field in the top-level conversation bodies listed. Please use the
> `_links.related.last_message` field instead.

post.description: Import a new message in an inbox.

get.description: List the teammates with access to an inbox.

post.description: Give access to one or more teammates to an inbox.

delete.description: Remove access of one or more teammates from an inbox.

get.description: List the links of the company paginated by id. Allows filtering by link type via the q.types param.

post.description: Create a link. If the link is resolved to an installed links integration, any name retrieved from the integration will override the provided name.

get.description: Fetch a link.

List the conversations linked to a specific link. For more advanced filtering, see the [search endpoint](https://dev.frontapp.com/reference/conversations#search-conversations).
>  Deprecated field included
>
> This endpoint returns a deprecated `last_message` field in the top-level conversation bodies listed. Please use the
> `_links.related.last_message` field instead.
Fetch the details of the API token.
List the message template folders.

post.description: Create a new message template folder.

get.description: Fetch a message template folder.

delete.description: Delete a message template folder and child folders/templates

get.description: Fetch the child message templates folders of a message template folder.

post.description: Create a new message template folder as a child of the given folder

parameters.name: message_template_folder_id
parameters.description: The parent message template folder ID

get.description: Fetch the child message templates of a message template folder.

post.description: Create a new message template as a child of the given folder

parameters.name: message_template_folder_id
parameters.description: The parent message template folder ID

get.description: List the message templates.

post.description: Create a new message template.

get.description: Fetch a message template.
Fetch a message.

Get the seen receipts for the given message. If no seen-by information is available, there will be a single entry for the first time the message was seen by any recipient. If seen-by information is available, there will be an entry for each recipient who has seen the message.

post.description: Mark an outbound message from Front as seen. Note, the message seen route should only be called in response to an actual end-user's message-seen action. In accordance with this behavior, the route is rate limited to 10 requests per hour.

get.description: List the rules of the company.

Fetch a shift.
List the teammates assigned to a shift.

post.description: Add teammates to a shift. The selected teammates must be in the team that owns the shift.

get.description: List the shifts.

post.description: Create a shift.
